security: Revealing the attempt to solicit a defection from a Cuban official, especially the description of the official as “very frightened” and “a key man,” could damage relations with Cuba and jeopardize the official's safety. Quoting directly: '[DE SOUZA] REPLIED HE MERELY PERFORMING HIS DUTY AND VERY FRIGHTENED. [DE SOUZA] DID STATE HE WOULD TALK WITH L-[3] AGAIN IN FIFTIPE INDEO SECURE CIRCUMSTANCES. L-[3] DESCRISES [DE SOUZA] AS 'A KEY MAN.'
summary: A cable from Mexico City reports a chance encounter in New York between L[TAMIL-3] and Antonio de Souza Carbajali, a Cuban exile, during which L[TAMIL-3] suggested de Souza's defection; de Souza expressed fear but indicated willingness to talk again under secure circumstances.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET cable, dated October 15, 1963, originates from the CIA station in Mexico City and reports that L[TAMIL-3], while contacting Cuban exiles in New York on October 7, had a chance encounter with Antonio de Souza Carbajali (FEMRER CLURAN). During their brief chat, L[TAMIL-3] proposed defection to de Souza, who replied he was merely doing his duty and was very frightened, though he also expressed a willingness to speak with L[TAMIL-3] again in more secure circumstances. L[TAMIL-3] described de Souza as “a key man,” leading to a request for traces, comments, and advice on a follow-up trip by L[TAMIL-3] to New York for the purpose of further conversation with de Souza.
title: PBRIUMEN HTBASTE 15 Oct 63 IN 40401
